page.title: 03 WILDLIFE
page.content:
IN THE AREA AROUND WYNYARD THERE ARE MANY DIFFERENT WILDLIFE HABITATS. THE MORE MATURE DECIDUOUS TREES PROVIDE THE PERFECT HOME FOR MANY HOLE RESTING BIRDS SUCH AS THE TAWNY OWL, WHICH IS COMMON IN THE THORPE WOOD, AND CAN BE HEARD SCREECHING IN THE EVENING. TREE CREEPERS CAN REGULARLY BE SEEN CLIMBING UP TREES IN SHORT SPURTS. THEY NEST IN CRACKS OF OLD TREES OR BEHIND CLIMBING IVY. THE LARGE POND AT THE CENTRE OF THORPE WOOD ATTRACTS MOORHEN, MALLARD AND HERONS. THE MOORHEN TAKE ADVANTAGES OF THE REED COVER TO NEST DURING THE BREEDING SEASON. THE KINDS OF ANIMALS YOU WOULD FIND AROUND WYNYARD ARE :-
